list_definition.definition: what makes one thing unlike another

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I can’t see any difference between these two pictures
It doesn’t make any difference to me whether you go or stay
There’s not much difference between them.

list_definition.definition: an act of differing, especially a disagreement

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We had a difference of opinion
Have they settled their differences? (= Have they stopped arguing?).

list_definition.definition: the amount by which one quantity or number is greater than another

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: If you buy it for me, I’ll give you $6 now and make up the difference later.

list_ex_of_english: We discuss the runtime differences in more detail in the rest of this section.
The differences, while statistically significant, are generally trivial (for example, the means on the democratic values index are 3.35 in 1996 and 3.27 in 1998).
One of the clear differences between fair employment and the s75 mainstreaming intervention lies in their focus.
The main differences are our use of dependent types to structure the "program" part of a development and our emphasis on reusable library components.
What impresses more than the differences is the similarity in composition.
A logistic regression is insensitive to differences in the number of cercariae per treatment; 20 -62 cercariae were present in the 0.5 ml aliquots.
The time factors show no differences over the period, and this would accord with consistent recording of deaths.
In other words, free and equal competition in the labour market is established by turning a blind eye to inconsequential differences.
